story.iWant: add and see a list of my company's holidays
story.soThat: the app has the data it needs to find my long weekends
story.tasks: Tasks/Subtasks: - Create HolidayForm component with input fields (AC: 1) - Implement HolidayForm.tsx functional component with TypeScript - Add "Holiday Name" text input with proper label and placeholder - Add "Holiday Date" date input with date picker functionality - Implement "Add Holiday" button with form submission handler - Apply Tailwind CSS styling following established patterns - Implement holiday addition functionality (AC: 2) - Create form validation for empty inputs - Implement addHoliday function using HolidayContext - Handle form submission and reset form fields - Provide user feedback on successful addition - Create HolidayList and HolidayListItem components (AC: 3, 4) - Implement HolidayList.tsx to display array of holidays - Implement HolidayListItem.tsx for individual holiday display - Format dates for readable display (e.g., "Thanksgiving - Thursday, Nov 27, 2025") - Add delete button to each HolidayListItem with confirmation - Implement deleteHoliday function from HolidayContext - Implement responsive design (AC: 5) - Ensure mobile-friendly layout with proper spacing - Test interface on mobile device sizes - Apply responsive Tailwind utilities for different screen sizes - Verify touch targets meet accessibility standards - Create comprehensive component tests (AC: 1-5) - Write unit tests for HolidayForm using React Testing Library - Write unit tests for HolidayList and HolidayListItem components - Test form validation scenarios and user interactions - Test holiday addition and deletion workflows - Verify responsive design behavior

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. I can see a simple form with a "Holiday Name" text input and a "Holiday Date" date picker 2. When I click an "Add Holiday" button, the holiday is added to a list visible on the page 3. The list of holidays is clearly visible and displays both the name and the formatted date (e.g., "Thanksgiving - Thursday, Nov 27, 2025") 4. I can click a "Delete" button next to any holiday in the list to remove it 5. The UI is responsive and usable on mobile
